job_description:
If you are an Intermediate Front-end Developer with Vue and AWS experience, please read on! We are still looking for the right fit regardless of the amount of applicants. Please don't hesitate to apply!

We are currently seeking a Vue JS Application Developer. This is a full-time position located in Tarpon Springs, FL. As a Vue JS developer, you’ll be part of a small and growing team that is responsible for the full software development life cycle, from conception to deployment, across various brands. You should be comfortable using CRUD with restful API’s, connecting third-party api’s, converting Figma designs to html & css, AWS and Node JS.

Qualifications
• Although this is primarily a front-end position, you should be comfortable with creating and managing api endpoints, setting up transactional emails, Node JS, AWS EC2 and RDS
• Front-end Development: 3 years (Required)
• 2+ years of Vue JS experience or equivalent (Required)
• 2+ years of Javascript experience
• PostgresSQL or MySQL
• CSS, SCSS and HTML
• Consuming and integrating REST API’s and websocket connections
• Agile
• Comfortable in FIGMA or Sketch

Responsibilities
• As a Vue JS developer, you’ll be part of a small team that is responsible for the full software development life cycle, from conception to deployment, across many brands.
• Review applications and supporting elements for the purpose of identifying potential improvements, enhancements, and other changes.
• Research front-end solutions, libraries, and frameworks in order to identify the best solution for the problem at hand
• Build and deploy front-end code whose quality is commensurately tied to the business goal and time constraints
• Analyze and resolve technical issues
• Event logging

Benefits
• Great opportunity for growth
• Stable company in a growing field
• 401k
• 401k Matching
• Health Insurance
• Paid Time Off (PTO)

Job Type: Full-time in person

PLEASE INCLUDE GITHUB LINK OR OTHER LINKS SHOWCASING YOUR WORK.

job_description:
A Biotech/agriculture company based in Lafayette is looking to bring on a Javascript Engineer well versed with Vue. This will be the most senior developer on the team and mentoring junior developers. This is a mission driven company that is working on maximizing natural resources and farming for small businesses across the US. This is a greenfield application used directly by the customer with lots of room for growth.

Required Skills & Experience
• 5+ years of Software Engineering experience
• Interested in working with Vue.js
• Production level experience with Javascript, HTML, CSS
Desired Skills & Experience
• Understanding Rest API's
• Computer Science background
• Python on the back end
What You Will Be Doing
Tech Breakdown
• 90% front end coding
• 10% back end (understanding API's)
Daily Responsibilities
• 100% hands on and team collaboration
• The Offer
• Up to $145k base + 10% bonus
You will receive the following benefits:
• Medical Insurance
• Dental Benefits
• Vision Benefits
• Paid Time Off (PTO)
• 401(k)
• Cable reimbursement

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future. Front End Engineer/Vue.js/Local to Lafayette

Qualifications: 5+ years of Software Engineering experience
Interested in working with Vue.js
Production level experience with Javascript, HTML, CSS
Responsibilities: 90% front end coding
10% back end (understanding API's)
100% hands on and team collaboration

Vue. Js Developer (Remote) Remote Job - United States | Posted - 12/06/22 Apply Easy Apply Overview

Hi,

Greetings!

Hope you are doing great. My name is Astha and I am a Technical Recruiter in United Software Group Inc., an Ohio based fast growing multi-national IT & Engineering Consulting Company, serving its Clients from last 20 years having staff strength of 2500 in 17 offices globally, operating across 8 countries in North America, Latin America, Asia Pacific and Europe.

USG Inc. is aggressively recruiting for Vue. Js Developer (Remote) to work on one of our client’s project. Please review the job details below and if interested, feel free to call me at 614-495-9222 Ext. 408 or reply to this email. In-case you are not interested, you may also refer anyone you may know who is looking for similar job.

Job Title: Vue. Js Developer

Job Location: (Remote)

Interview Type: Video

Position Type: Contract

Experience Required: 6+

Work Authorization: U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor F1 candidates at this time

Job Description
• Expert JavaScript developer who is highly skilled with Vue.js. Primary focus will be developing user-facing web applications and components, implement them with the Vue.js framework, following generally accepted practices and workflows. Ensure to produce robust, secure, modular, and maintainable code. Coordinate with other team members, including back-end developers and UX/UI designers. Also should be able to create, run testing using JEST framework.

Responsibilities
• Developing user-facing applications using Vue.js
• Building modular and reusable components and libraries
• Optimizing your application for performance

Experience with JEST for creating, running, and structuring tests is must
• Implementing automated testing integrated into development and maintenance workflows
• Staying up-to-date with all recent developments in the JavaScript and Vue.js space
• Keeping an eye on security updates and issues found with Vue.js and all project dependencies
• Proposing any upgrades and updates necessary for keeping up with modern security and development best practices

Skills
• Highly proficient with the JavaScript language and its modern ES6+ syntax and features
• Highly proficient with Vue.js framework and its core principles such as components, reactivity, and the virtual DOM
• Familiarity with the Vue.js ecosystem, including Vue CLI, Vuex, Vue Router, and Nuxt.js

Good experience with JEST testing is also must
• Good understanding of HTML5 and CSS3, including
• Understanding of server-side rendering and its benefits and use cases
• Knowledge of functional programming and object-oriented programming paradigms
• Ability to write efficient, secure, well-documented, and clean JavaScript code
• Experience with both consuming and designing RESTful APIs

Thanks & Regards,

Astha Rai

USG Inc.

HQ: 6000 Venture Dr,

Ste C-D, Dublin, Ohio 43017

job_description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

At Ford Motor Company, we believe freedom of movement drives human progress. Unique challenges require the problem-solving skills of a diverse range of individuals.

We also believe in providing you with the freedom to define and realize your dreams. With our incredible plans for the future of mobility, we have a wide variety of opportunities for you to accelerate your career potential as you help us define tomorrow’s transportation.

As a key member of our Information Technology group, you’ll play a critical part in shaping the future of mobility. If you’re looking for the chance to leverage advanced technology to redefine the transportation landscape, enhance the customer experience and improve people’s lives, this is the opportunity for you. Join us and challenge your IT expertise and analytical skills to help create vehicles that are as smart as you are.

As a developer, you will collaborate with a broad array of talented software engineers to build amazing software that will transform Ford.com into the standard for how vehicles are purchased online.

Innovate, problem-solve, and build new features and exciting capabilities to support launches of upcoming Model e vehicle lines.
RESPONSIBILITIES

What you’ll be able to do:
• Develop Ford iteratively in a pair-programming environment
• Create features based on regular user interviews and fast feedback
• Work in an environment where you can learn and share knowledge openly
• Define, foster, and advance your team’s culture, norms, and practices
• Choose to work remotely, on-site, or both
• Maintain a healthy work-life balance while revolutionizing automotive e-commerce.

QUALIFICATIONS

The minimum requirements we seek:
• Bachelor's degree. Preferred in Computer Science.
• 2+ years of understanding, practicing, and advocating for clean code principles such as test-driven development (TDD), self-documenting code, continuous refactoring, and Extreme Programming (XP)
• 2+ years of experience and proficiency in front-end languages such as JavaScript/Typescript, and a familiarity with other languages such as Java
• 2+ years of practical, meaningful experience with Vue.js front-end framework.

Our preferred requirements:
• Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field OR a combination of education and equivalent experience
• Experience with web and mobile accessibility standards (WCAG compliance), tools, and testing (e.g. screen-readers, axe, user interviews)
• Experience with Behavior Driven Development
• 2+ years of practical, meaningful experience with front-end frameworks such as React and Angular
• Familiarity with Adobe Experience Manager (AEM)
• Mechanical and engineering empathy
• A desire to collaborate closely with UI/UX designers.

What you’ll receive in return:

As part of the Ford family, you’ll enjoy excellent compensation and a comprehensive benefits package that includes generous PTO, retirement, savings and stock investment plans, incentive compensation and much more. You’ll also experience exciting opportunities for professional and personal growth and recognition!

Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States on a permanent basis. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire.

Visa sponsorship is available for this position.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status.

For information on Ford's salary and benefits, please see here.

Join our team as we build tomorrow! We believe in putting people first, working together, and facing challenges head-on, because we’re Built Ford Tough. We’re one team striving to make people’s lives better while crafting value, delivering excellence, and ultimately going for the win.

JOB INFO
• Job Identification
• 15589
• Job Category
• Enterprise Technology
• Posting Date
• 07/28/2023, 02:07 AM
• Job Schedule
• Full time
• Locations
• 1655 Fairlane Circle, Allen Park, MI, 48101, US (Remote)
• Remote
• Yes.

Qualifications: Bachelor's degree
Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire
Responsibilities: Develop Ford iteratively in a pair-programming environment
Create features based on regular user interviews and fast feedback
Work in an environment where you can learn and share knowledge openly
Define, foster, and advance your team’s culture, norms, and practices
Choose to work remotely, on-site, or both
Maintain a healthy work-life balance while revolutionizing automotive e-commerce
Benefits: As part of the Ford family, you’ll enjoy excellent compensation and a comprehensive benefits package that includes generous PTO, retirement, savings and stock investment plans, incentive compensation and much more
You’ll also experience exciting opportunities for professional and personal growth and recognition!

job_title: Junior Developer - Vue.js / PHP / Laravel (Must be located in Detroit, MI)
job_description:
• *Must be located in Detroit MI **

Job Summary

Mayesh Wholesale Florist, Inc. is looking for a talented PHP Developer to join our growing team. The ideal candidate is a self-starter with a strong work ethic and attention to detail. They are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, and are able to work autonomously with minimal supervision.

As a PHP Developer, you will be responsible for the development of web applications using PHP and MySQL. You will work closely with the other developers and project managers to ensure that applications are built in accordance with project requirements and deliverables.

Responsibilities
• Gain understanding of the business requirements to effectively translate product features into technical development tasks.
• Create new features using best practices at every stage of the development cycle: emphasis on clean and maintainable code, good test coverage, continuous integration, and rapid deployment.
• Create API endpoints for consumption by front end.
• Defines, designs and implements complex web-based applications using but not limited to Laravel, Vue and MySQL.
• Performs peer code review to ensure highest level of efficiency throughout all custom-developed web-based applications.
• Conducts testing and troubleshooting to meet quality standards.
• Investigate issues and implement code fixes.
• Confirm the reliability of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript on other platforms
• Maintain and design databases with performance optimization
• Perform backend and UI tests for better functionality
• Stay abreast with the latest technology patterns and trends
• Document the project’s architecture, progress, and development
• Implement coding and security standards with best practices
• Ensure coordination with team members, project managers, and other stakeholders
• Create written documentation for the different components.

Requirements
• A degree in programming, computer science, or a related field.
• The ability to problem-solve and critically think.
• High level of knowledge of PHP and the Laravel framework.
• Understanding of the MVC pattern.
• Knowledge of database design and querying using MySQL.
• Excellent Communication and interpersonal Skills.
• Experience with Git version control system
• Experience with AWS Cloud Hosting
• Experience working with PHP, performing unit testing, and managing APIs such as REST.
• Proficiency in JavaScript. Vue.js and jquery experience required.
• Proficiency in HTML5 and CSS3. Bootstrap5 experience a plus.
• A portfolio of applications and programs to your name.

Job Type: Full-time

Experience level:
• 2 years

Work Location: In person

They are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, and are able to work autonomously with minimal supervision

job_description:
We, at Turing, are looking for talented remote Vue.js/Python developers who will be primarily responsible for full-stack development including coding, designing, deploying, and debugging applications. Here's your chance to collaborate with top industry veterans while working with leading Silicon Valley companies. Job description Job responsibilities Build end-to-end web applications that are responsive and secure Optimize applications for enhanced performance and responsiveness Integrate server-side logic with front-end elements Write reusable and efficient code Perform regular code reviews to improve and evolve Collaborate with product managers, developers, and designers to build innovative web apps Minimum requirements Bachelor's/Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, IT (or equivalent experience) 3
years of experience in full-stack development (rare exceptions for highly skilled developers) Solid experience developing with Python and Vue.js Experience with JavaScript, its frameworks and libraries Experience using HTML and CSS technologies In-depth knowledge in Django or a similar framework Experience working with SQL/NoSQL databases Sound knowledge of core Vue.js principles, workflows, and assorted toolkits Experience with Vue CLI, Vuex, Vue Router, and Nuxt.js Fluent in English to communicate effectively Ability to work full-time (40 hours/week) with a 4 hour overlap with US time zones Preferred skills Familiarity with automated testing tools and technologies Knowledge of PostgreSQL and Rest APIs Experience with code versioning tools such as Git Experience in building large-scale Vue.js/Python-based applications Excellent organizational and communication skills Great technical, analytical and problem-solving skills.
Salary Range:
$80K -- $100K
Minimum Qualification
Software DevelopmentEstimated Salary: $20 to $28 per hour based on qualifications.

What is your current US visa status?
